newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Cricket-West Indies all out for 181 v Pakistan.
newsitem.headline: Cricket-West Indies all out for 181 v Pakistan.

text.p: West Indies collapsed to be all out for 181 in their World Series limited overs match against Pakistan at the Sydney Cricket Ground on Tuesday.
West Indies lost their last eight wickets for 25 to be all out in 47.3 overs.
Shivnarine Chanderpaul and Adrian Griffith had earlier taken West Indies to 156 for three after a partnership of 106 before the middle-order and tail fell away with minimal resistance.
Chanderpaul top-scored for West Indies with 72 while Griffith made 47.

Off-spinner Saqlain Mushtaq was the chief destroyer for Pakistan, taking four for 17 from nine overs. Pace bowler Waqar Younis made an encouraging return after a long lay-off through injury and took three for 34 from 10 overs.
Both teams have already qualified for the series finals starting in Sydney on Saturday, prompting West Indies to rest captain Courtney Walsh and star batsman Brian Lara.
Carl Hooper, deputising for Walsh, made just one run batting at number seven.
